H0.text: Being open to new ideas is the characteristic a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

H1.text: Sharing limited research is a characteristic that a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

H2.text: Focus on completing research first is the characteristic that a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

H3.text: Focus on formulating conclusions is a characteristic that a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

A4.text: Measurements collected can be archived, passed onwards and used by others.

A5.text: Failure of a hypothesis to produce interesting and testable predictions may lead to reconsideration of the hypothesis or of the definition of the subject.

A6.text: Scientific skeptics maintain that empirical investigation of reality leads to the most reliable empirical knowledge, and suggest that the scientific method is best suited to verifying results.

A7.text: Scientific skeptics do not assert that unusual claims should be automatically rejected out of hand on a priori groundsâ€”rather they argue that one should critically examine claims of paranormal or anomalous phenomena and that extraordinary claims would require extraordinary evidence in their favor before they could be accepted as having validity.
